stem: A patient presents with burning pain over the dorsolateral thumb triggered by tight watchbands. Motor strength is normal. Tinel sign over the distal radial forearm reproduces symptoms. Which nerve is affected?

choices.A: Superficial branch of the radial nerve

rationale_correct: Wartenberg syndrome is entrapment of the superficial radial nerve causing sensory pain over the dorsolateral thumb without motor involvement.

rationale_distractors.B: Posterior interosseous nerve entrapment leads to motor weakness of finger extension.
rationale_distractors.C: Ulnar dorsal cutaneous branch supplies the ulnar dorsum, not the thumb.
rationale_distractors.D: Median palmar cutaneous branch affects central palm sensation, not dorsal thumb.
rationale_distractors.E: Lateral antebrachial cutaneous nerve supplies lateral forearm, not dorsolateral thumb.
